title: Force on wire due to magnetic field of 3 wires

content.question: Which of the following is a correct expression for the magnitude of the net force per length on the top right wire due to the other three wires?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator, the square root of 2, end root, times I squared, times mu sub 0, and denominator 4 pi a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt><msup><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator I squared, times mu sub 0, and denominator 2 pi a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator, the square root of 2, end root, times I squared, times mu sub 0, and denominator 2 pi a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt><msup><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator, the cube root of 2, end root, times I squared, times mu sub 0, and denominator 4 pi a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mroot><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mroot><msup><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator, the square root of 2, end root, times I squared, times mu sub 0, and denominator 4 pi a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt><msup><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
